name: 演化式計算
goals: Understand the principle of various evolutionary algorithms
Use programing languages to implement various evolutionary algorithms, and analyze the experimental results.
Get familiar with computational platforms for running evolutionary algorithms.
Cultivate research ability through problem-solving thinking.
Enhance comprehension ability of engineering problems. Use various evolutionary algorithms to obtain solutions through optimization.
Cultivate the ability to search for relevant technical literature and improve self-learning ability.
Ability to conduct thematic research in small groups and develop the ability of team working.
syllabus:
16+2 weeks (Lectures from Weeks 1 to 16; Self learning in Weeks 17 and 18)

Weeks 1-2: Introduction

Weeks 3-5: Genetic Algorithms

Week 6: Evolutionary strategies

Week 7: Genetic Programming

Week 8: Particle Swarm Optimization

Week 9: NM simplex search method / Hybridization with other techniques

Weeks 10-11: Multimodal problems and multi-objective evolutionary algorithms

Week 12: Parallel Computation of Evolutionary Algorithms

Week 13: Particle filter based approach

Week 14: Special topics on Evolutionary Computation

Weeks 15-16: Presentation and group discussion

Weeks 17-18: Self-learning

methodologies.note: Introduce the relevant principles and techniques of various evolutionary algorithms
Discuss engineering optimization issues in small groups
Students write programs to implement and verify various evolutionary algorithms
Students choose a practical application or specific evolutionary algorithm as a research project.

grading.note: Submit experimental results and a written report for each assignment
Oral presentation and written report of a special project chosen by the student

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
